pl_output:
dark.numbers is a library for working with numbers.

  `Na`(`Vx`):       `Nabsolute value` of `Vx`
  `Nb`:          (not yet used)
  `Nc`(`Vx`, `Vy`, `Vz`): `Nclamps` `Vx` to range [`Vy`, `Vz`]
  `Nd`(`Vx`):       `Nduration` of number of seconds `Vx`
  `Ne`:          (not yet used)
  `Nf`(`Vx`, `Vy`):    reverse-truncates `Vx` to the `Nfarthest` `Vy`
  `Ng`:          (not yet used)
  `Nh`(`Vx`):       makes `Nhexadecimal` string from `Vx`
  `Ni`(`Vx`):       checks if `Vx` `Nis` a number
  `Nj`:          (not yet used)
  `Nk`:          (not yet used)
  `Nl`:          (not yet used)
  `Nm`(`Vx`):       number of `Nmilliseconds` in duration `Vx`
  `Nn`(`Vx`, `Vy`):    truncates `Vx` to the `Nnearest` `Vy`
  `No`           (not yet used)
  `Np`(`Vx`):       checks if `Vx` is `Nprime`
  `Nq`:          (not yet used)
  `Nr`(`Vx`):       generates `Nrandom` number in [0, `Vx`)
  `Ns`(`Vx`):       number of `Nseconds` in duration `Vx`
  `Nt`:          (not yet used)
  `Nu`(`Vx`, `Vy`, `Vz`): picks `Nunit` for `Vx`: single `Vy` or plural `Vz`
  `Nv`:          (not yet used)
  `Nw`:          (not yet used)
  `Nx`:          (not yet used)
  `Ny`:          (not yet used)
  `Nz`(`Vx`, `Vy`):    `Nzero`-pads `Vx` to `Vy` digits long
  `N$`:          (not yet used)
  `N_`:          (not yet used)

duration is of the form xW yD zH wMIN tS where xyzw are integers and t is float. leading/trailing
spaces, spaces between units, and case are ignored.
